other_tests.findings: Temporal avascularity with dragging of the temporal vessels to an area of fibrosis in the right eye.
Temporal retinal detachment (macula off) with dragging of the disc, macula, and retinal vessels toward an area of fibrosis in the left eye.
other_tests.changes_over_time: The retinal detachment in the left eye progressed, and at 12 months, a temporal falciform retinal fold was evident.

other_tests.findings: A de novo microdeletion on chromosome 22q11.2 was found in the patient.
No mutations were identified in the known FEVR genes (FZD4 and LRP5).
Applied to peripheral avascular retina in the better right eye.
other_tests.changes_over_time: 12 months later, visual function and fundal appearance remained stable.
